intro: Atropis fontqueri, commonly known as the Cape tulip, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its showy, daisy-like flowers that range in color from yellow to orange. The plant typically grows in coastal areas and is adapted to sandy, well-drained soils. It has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces seeds in a distinctive, cylindrical seed head. Atropis fontqueri is often cultivated for its ornamental value in gardens and landscapes.
